DataElement.preferredName: Colony Forming Unit Laboratory Procedure Post Thaw Performed Total Colony-Forming Unit-Granulocyte Macrophage Assay Count
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric value measured, assigned or computed related to the assessment of the total number of colony-forming unit-granulocyte macrophage assays counted.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Colony Forming Unit Laboratory Procedure Post Thaw Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A unit of measurement of viable bacterial numbers. Colony forming unit (CFU) is the minimum number of separable cells, which is able to produce a visible colony of progeny. The examples of CFU usage include but not limited to the measurement of the number of bacteria present in the environment, and the ability of stem cells to produce cells of single or multiple lineages._Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting._Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order._The process whereby heat changes something from a solid to a liquid._Executed and carried through to completion.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A unit of measurement of viable bacterial numbers. Colony forming unit (CFU) is the minimum number of separable cells, which is able to produce a visible colony of progeny. The examples of CFU usage include but not limited to the measurement of the number of bacteria present in the environment, and the ability of stem cells to produce cells of single or multiple lineages.:A medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood, urine, or other substance from the body. Tests can help determine a diagnosis, plan treatment, check to see if treatment is working, or monitor the disease over time.

Concepts.definition: The minimum number of separable cells which is able to produce a detectable colony of progeny. Examples of CFU usage include, but are not limited to, the measurement of the number of viable bacteria present in the environment, and the ability of stem cells to produce cells of single or multiple lineages.
Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: Post; occuring after.:The process whereby heat changes something from a solid to a liquid.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: Happening at a time subsequent to a reference time; later in time or order.
The process whereby heat changes something from a solid to a liquid.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Total Colony-Forming Unit-Granulocyte Macrophage Assay Count
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition._A functional (qualitative) as well as quantitative assay that is utilized as an indicator of granulopoiesis reconstitution._To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity x10E5. [manual entered]

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Total Colony-Forming Unit-Granulocyte Macrophage Assay Count
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete.:A functional (qualitative) as well as quantitative assay that is utilized as an indicator of granulopoiesis reconstitution.:To determine the number or amount of something; the result of this activity.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.
A functional (qualitative) as well as quantitative assay that is utilized as an indicator of granulopoiesis reconstitution.
Determining the number or amount of something.
